subject: Sleep
title: How Age Changes Cycle Composition
description: One-minute skill: How Age Changes Cycle Composition.

hook.text: A teenager can sleep 10 hours of solid, cycle-rich sleep. A 70-year-old struggles to complete four cycles.

buildup.text: With age, deep sleep shrinks dramatically. N3 can drop from 20 percent to less than five percent.

discovery.text: REM also decreases but more gradually. Light N2 sleep fills the gaps left by lost deep sleep.

twist.text: Older adults wake more often between cycles because lighter sleep is easier to disrupt.

climax.text: The total need for sleep may not change much. The ability to achieve consolidated sleep does.

punchline.text: Aging doesn't reduce sleep need. It reduces sleep ability.

quiz.question: What happens to deep sleep as people age?
options: It can drop from 20 percent to under 5 percent
